D√∂neminin en iyi oyunlarƒ±ndan birisidir Half Life. Gerek hikayesi olsun gerek de oynanƒ±≈ü mekanikleri.. Eƒüer bu d√∂nemde iyi mi diye sorarsanƒ±z bunun cevabƒ± ki≈üiden ki≈üiye g√∂re deƒüi≈üir. Tek sorun Online'daki bu oyunu yƒ±llardƒ±r oynayan manyak oyuncular...

As most people know, half-life is a classic game filled with cool enemies, epic mechanics, and a perfect story. Anyone who has played this game long enough will tell you that it's worth the struggle in-game, and the memories that will come with it last forever!

One of the best games in its days (and still is), Half Life hasn't aged a single bit, the game is still fun, community servers are still going. This game will stay as a classic until it is forgotten. Which it will never be.

Classic staple of the FPS genre, 100% recommend you check this one out. 

Also: now having played Black Mesa and this, I'd recommend you guys check this, the original game, (Not Half-Life Source for the love of god,) over Black Mesa. Where Black Mesa does a lot of cool things, you can't really appreciate them if you don't check out the original game. 

Also: Black Mesa drags out a lot of the set pieces from the original game, for better or for worse. For example, the Xen levels go on for around 3-4 hours in Black Mesa, where I spent maybe 45 minutes to an hour in them here. That brevity in many sections works in the original games favor a lot of the time.

THIS IS THE BEST VIDEO GAME I HAVE EVER PLAYED IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. 

I'm saying this as a someone who made a first time ever play-through in late 2020

When you think of the term 'video game', HL1 is the ABSOLUTE embodiment of it.

Gameplay, Combat, Environment and Storytelling, it surpasses these in every possible way beyond any modern game. 

I'm in awe as to how well, the movement, combat and gameplay holds up this far on, and dare I say it is still the best.

A Personal Favorite: 23 years later, the environments all look like something like they are out of 'The Backrooms' meme, there was not a corner turned in this game that wasn't in pure anticipation. 

It is truly a blessing to know that Gabe Newell himself was part responsible for the programming and design of this game. He is the reason PC gaming is so alive and well today.

Que mas se puede decir de este titulo que ya no se hayan dicho en otras rese√±as?  No obstante hay algo que me gustar√≠a hacer saber sobre el multijugador.

Como sabr√°n los servidores del mismo juego est√°n un poco muertos, pero no hay porque alarmarse amigos, en internet encontraran much√≠simos servidores que siempre estan a full. Yo en lo personal juego en Gametracker, les dejare unos peque√±os pasos muy sencillos para usar este servidor:

1. Ingresar en su navegador ''Gametracker''.

2. Una vez aqu√≠, seleccionaremos un juego y la regi√≥n en la parte superior de la pantalla.

3. Les aparecer√° much√≠simos servidores, entren al que mas les plasca (Recomiendo las de Per√∫, porque son las que mas activa estan).

4. Copiar la IP y agregarla al juego en favoritos.

5. Listo pap√°, ya ten√©s multiplayer para rato

The greatest FPS of all time...With some kinks

Half-Life is not only what I consider the greatest FPS game of all time, but it is also my favorite game of all time. So instead of talking about all the things I could say that make it so perfect, like it's storytelling, it's freedom, it's gameplay, its wonderful environments, its atmosphere. I will talk about the ways it's not so perfect, Half-Life has not aged well in some departments, it can be kinda directionless, comedic in moments where it's not meant to be, and a bit clunky with some mechanics and full areas. I mean have you seen Xen? It's gunplay is also very basic in most situations with it really only being held up with the excellent AI, basically what I'm getting at is the game is not perfect. But I love the game all the same and highly recommend at least one playthrough.
